questions.question: Rigidity of a gyroscope depends on:
options: a. weight, force applied and speed of rotation
b. rate of precession and the force applied
c. weight, rate of precession and speed of rotation
d. mass, radius of gyration and speed of rotation

questions.question: A force is applied to deflect a gyroscope. If the rpm of the gyro is then doubled, the precession rate will:
options: a. remain as before
b. increase
c. decrease
d. cease altogether

questions.question: In gyroscopic theory the term 'topple' is defined as:
options: a. real wander only, in the horizontal plane
b. real wander only, in the vertical plane
c. wander, real or apparent, in the vertical plane
d. wander, real or apparent, in the horizontal plane

questions.question: A force applied to the spinning axis of a rotor is precessed:
options: a. through $90^{\circ}$ in the direction of spin of the rotor
b. through $90^{\circ}$ in the direction of spin of the rotor in the northern hemisphere and through $90^{\circ}$ in the opposite direction in the southern hemisphere
c. through $270^{\circ}$ in the direction of spin of the rotor
d. at a rate proportional to the speed of rotation of the gyro

questions.question: Real wander of a gyro can be caused by:
options: a. asymmetrical friction at the spinning axis
b. rotation of the earth
c. increasing the rpm of the rotor
d. moving the gyro north or south of its present position

questions.question: A gyro with only one degree of freedom is known as a:
options: a. tied gyro
b. earth gyro
c. space gyro
d. rate gyro

questions.question: A perfectly balanced space gyro at the equator has its spin axis aligned with true north. After 6 hours the axis will be be aligned with:
options: a. true east direction
b. true west direction
c. true north direction
d. true south direction

questions.question: The main advantage of electric gyros are:
options: a. high rpm, only require low voltage DC, constant speed, sealed casing
b. light weight, high rpm, constant speed, inexpensive
c. high rpm, high moment of inertia, rapid build-up of speed, constant RPM
d. sealed casing, constant speed, high precession rate, low cost

questions.question: Apparent wander of a gyro can be caused by:
options: a. rotation of the earth
b. clear air turbulence
c. gimbal friction
d. external torque
